isis.stitle: TSI 91-04-02 - False Hydraulic Brake Warning Indication

geninfo.para: This TSI describes false hydraulic brake warning indication on all vehicles with hydraulic brakes, Model Year 1988 to present with Hydro-max Monitor Module.

svcproc.title: SERVICE PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: The hydraulic brake monitor module monitors several functions of the hydraulic brake system. If the monitor module detects an abnormal condition, it illuminates the brake warning light and sounds a beeper. Two areas to check when there is a warning indication but no apparent defect are as follows:

item.para: False indications when turning on the parking or headlights is usually the result of poor stop and tail light grounds. Check and clean all stop and tail light grounds and then coat with Grafo grease (part number 472141C1). In instances where stop and tail lights have been relocated to a truck or bus body by a body builder, it is necessary that the body be well grounded to the chassis.

False indication can also result from non-synchronized brake light and backup motor switches (brake pedal activated). Adjust switches so they activate simultaneously. To reduce the need for frequent adjustment of these switches, a revised brake monitor module with increased timing is available under part number 1658510C3. The color of the new module has been changed from gray to black to make it easily identifiable. The new module was incorporated into production vehicles effective approximately April 20, 1991.
